page.title: 16Local History
page.content:
Chertsey's existence was established by the founding of an Abbey, and Frithward has been regarded as it's great benefactor and founder. The town name 'Chertsey' was established before the Abbey was founded.
'Ceortey-ige' or '-ege' was the original Saxon name for Chertsey. This indicates that the original settlement was an island, belonging to Cerota.
By 666 A.D. the name had been changed to 'Cirotes-eye' and similar versions are 'Cerota's Eye and 'Sirotes-egt'. These lead to the modern name Chertsey in 1668.
